required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Adaptive Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy Optimization at Rest and During Exercise (AdOPT CRT)
clinical_study.official_title: Adaptive Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy Optimization at Rest and During Exercise (AdOPT CRT)

lead_sponsor.agency: Medtronic Cardiac Rhythm and Heart Failure

clinical_study.source: Medtronic Cardiac Rhythm and Heart Failure

brief_summary.textblock: The AdOPT Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy (CRT) study is an acute, prospective, multi-center, non-randomized investigational study designed to compare indices of cardiac function at device settings optimized using the investigational Adaptive CRT (aCRT) algorithm versus nominal programming. The comparison will be performed during rest, atrial pacing and sub-maximal exercise. AdOPT CRT is a sub study of the Adaptive CRT Study (NTC00980057) being conducted in Europe.

detailed_description.textblock: Adaptive CRT is an implantable heart failure device feature that attempts to optimize CRT without echocardiographic testing.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Decision was made to stop the study based on a pre-planned interim analysis that the sample size would unlikely be sufficient to satisfy the primary objective.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Test day visit (within 14 days of enrollment)
primary_outcome.description: Difference in stroke volume (SV) between BiV pacing with aCRT settings and BiV pacing with nominal settings at rest. Biventricular pacing is a type of pacing that paces both the right and left ventricles of the heart. Stroke volume is the volume of blood pumped from a ventricle in one heart beat.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Test day visit (within 14 days of enrollment)
primary_outcome.description: Difference in SV between BiV pacing with aCRT settings and BiV pacing with nominal settings during atrial pacing. Atrial pacing occurs at 20 beats-per-minute (bpm) above the subject's resting heart rate.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Test day visit (within 14 days of enrollment)
primary_outcome.description: Difference in SV between BiV pacing with aCRT settings and BiV pacing with nominal settings during sub-maximal exercise. Sub-maximal exercise is exercise performed at a level below maximum effort. The subject will perform sub-maximal exercise to achieve target heart rate close to 75% of the age-predicted maximal heart rate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cardiac Function With aCRT Settings at Rest
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Test day visit (within 14 days of enrollment)
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in blood pressure (BP)-derived and echocardiogram (echo)-derived parameters of cardiac function between BiV pacing with aCRT settings and BiV pacing with nominal settings at rest.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cardiac Function With Nominal Settings at Rest.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Test day visit (within 14 days of enrollment)
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in BP-derived and echo-derived parameters of cardiac function between BiV pacing with nominal settings and intrinsic conduction at rest.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Test day visit (within 14 days of enrollment)
secondary_outcome.description: Electrical conduction will be evaluated at rest by measuring the subject's intrinsic atrio-ventricular (AV) interval. The AV interval is the amount time between the start of atrial contraction and the start of ventricular contraction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cardiac Function With aCRT Settings During Sub-maximal Exercise.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Test day visit (within 14 days of enrollment)
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in BP-derived and echocardiogram (echo)-derived parameters of cardiac function between BiV pacing with aCRT settings and BiV pacing with nominal settings during sub-maximal exercise.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cardiac Function With Nominal Settings During Sub-maximal Exercise.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Test day visit (within 14 days of enrollment)
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in BP-derived and echo-derived parameters of cardiac function between BiV pacing with nominal settings and intrinsic conduction during sub-maximal exercise.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time Frame: Test day visit (within 14 days of enrollment)
secondary_outcome.description: Electrical conduction will be evaluated during sub-maximal exercise by measuring the subject's intrinsic AV interval.

arm_group.description: Cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) with adaptive pacing.

intervention.description: Market approved Medtronic Vision 3D™ CRT-D implantable device.
Adaptive CRT pacing software adjusts how the device paces the heart based on the patient's current heart status.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject is age 18 or greater
- Subject is willing to sign and date the study Informed Consent form
- Subject has been implanted with a clinically indicated CRT-D device (Medtronic Vision 3D or Protecta models) for at least 1 month but less than 7 months from the date of study enrollment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject has a history of persistent or permanent AF for which pharmacological therapy and/or cardioversion have been unsuccessful or have not been attempted.
- Subject has atrial or ventricular tachyarrhythmias or frequent atrial or ventricular ectopy at the time of enrollment.
- Subject's resting heart rate at the time of enrollment exceeds 90 bpm.
- Subject had CRT system implanted for more than 7 months from the date of the study enrollment
- Subject has complete AV block.
- Subject had previous mechanical valve surgeries.
- Subject has congenital heart disease.
- Subject has contraindication for an exercise test.
- Subject is unable to perform a sub-maximal exercise test.
- It is not possible to acquire technically acceptable echocardiographic images.
- Subject has medical conditions that would limit study participation.
- Subject is pregnant (all women of child-bearing potential must undergo a pregnancy test within seven days prior to the study visit).
- Subject is enrolled in the Adaptive CRT study
- Subject is enrolled in concurrent studies which could confound the results of this study.
- Subject meets exclusion criteria required by local law

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Twelve subjects were enrolled at six centers in Europe between November 2011 and March 2012.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: In most cases, contracts allow investigators to publish study results per the protocol and publication plan following Medtronic's review to determine whether confidential information (CI) is disclosed. Any such CI is deleted prior to publication/presentation. Medtronic may not censor/interfere with the publication except as described. Investigators may not publish any single-site publications until the main multi-site study publication has occurred.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: A pre-planned interim evaluation of the sample size calculation assumptions was conducted. The variability of the outcome measures was higher than assumed. The study was stopped since the planned sample size would unlikely be sufficient.
